question:
The slope of the line $3x+5y+1=0$ is $m_1 = - rac{3}{5}$. 
The slope of a line perpendicular to it is $m = - rac{1}{m_1} = - rac{1}{(-3/5)} =  rac{5}{3}$. 
Since this line is represented by the pair of lines $kx^2+2xy-3y^2=0$, substituting $y/x = m$ gives $k + 2m - 3m^2 = 0$. 
Substitute $m =  rac{5}{3}$: 
$$k + 2\left( rac{5}{3}ight) - 3\left( rac{5}{3}ight)^2 = 0$$ 
$$k +  rac{10}{3} - 3\left( rac{25}{9}ight) = 0$$ 
$$k +  rac{10}{3} -  rac{25}{3} = 0$$ 
$$k -  rac{15}{3} = 0 \implies k - 5 = 0 \implies k = 5$$.
